lead_paragraph: Macy’s announcement closely follows that of Walmart, which said it would buy Jet.com in what is widely viewed as a way to invigorate its online sales.

byline.original: By RACHEL ABRAMS and SAPNA MAHESHWARI

headline.print_headline: Losing Ground to Web Rivals, Macy’s Shrinks
headline.main: Macy’s to Close 100 Stores as E-Rivals and Discounting Hit Legacy Retailers

snippet: Macy’s announcement closely follows that of Walmart, which said it would buy Jet.com in what is widely viewed as a way to invigorate its online sales....
abstract: Macy's announces it will close 100 stores, pointing out the brick-and-mortar outlets are more valuable as real estate properties; decision, which comes on heels of Walmart's announcement that it will buy small online rival Jet.com for $3 billion, is indication of how growth in online shopping is impacting legacy retail stores.
